Planet XJ-245: This planet is located in the habitable zone of its star and has a similar climate to Earth. It is also believed to have liquid water, which is essential for life as we know it.
Europa: This moon of Jupiter is believed to have an ocean of liquid water beneath its icy surface. It also has geysers that spout water vapor into space, indicating the presence of subsurface life.
Kepler-438b: This exoplanet is located in the habitable zone of its star and is about 4.5 times the size of Earth. It has a similar atmosphere to Earth and is believed to have liquid water.
Proxima Centauri b: This exoplanet is located in the habitable zone of its star and is about 1.1 times the size of Earth. It has a similar atmosphere to Earth and is believed to have liquid water.
Enceladus: This moon of Saturn has geysers that spout water vapor into space, indicating the presence of subsurface life. It also has a liquid water ocean beneath its icy surface.
